document.title: ARIZONA CTE PROGRAM STANDARDS AND MEASUREMENT CRITERIA

317E0C591D724B95958D598BF69383C6.description: Follow written facility testing procedures and protocol

96EAB8EB23034C06959F5D7997F19938.description: Use terms, abbreviations, and codes commonly used in laboratory testing

F9F0F467816540D2B00A4262FC94C609.description: Function within the laboratory assistant’s scope of practice (duties and responsibilities)

E8E13E89D5734F06A7F92D91F68DAA97.description: Protect patient confidentiality according to HIPPA guidelines

C2DC12CBE43E4A5BA2107C3D5550D965.description: Comply with the Patients’ Bill of Rights according to AMA (American Medical Association) and AHA (American Hospital Association)

E6D7EEDFD4ED4139AD779F955906CEE2.description: Recognize liability associated with the practice of laboratory assisting (risk management, patient refusal to comply)

94038CFADA88440381C1C1EF6AEE36CC.description: Assess active involvement in local, state, and national associations and organizations (people and resources) to keep up-to-date regarding the industry

E89E87044D5C4271ADFF0EFA8B471CF3.description: Communicate test results, reference ranges, and specimen requirements to authorized sources according to HIPPA guidelines

34FBCFE8B85C463FAFB5AAA681FA0224.description: Comply with voluntary accrediting and inspection agency requirements [e.g., CAP (College of American Pathologists), Joint Commission , and AABB (American Association of Blood Banks)]

FA713C60D51C48539B34EBEB5123590B.description: Adhere to CLIA (Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments) regulations and their impact on laboratory functions and procedures

95C20CFDA9F64B8D80DB2B0F22BB5AB3.description:
Comply with federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and guidelines for the laboratory [e.g., CMS (Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services), CDC (Center for Disease Control), OSHA, CLIA (Clinical Laboratory
Improvement Amendment)]

68CBDE1B580C445DA316B241BF1DE644.description: MAINTAIN THE LABORATORY ACCORDING TO INDUSTRY REGULATIONS AND STANDARDS

9D0CB4B72E8642358A2363E44259DC1D.description: Demonstrate proper body mechanics and lifting techniques

52E7306C691F492FB69EFAAA45FE3254.description: Report unsafe conditions for self and others (e.g., frayed cords, spillages, puddles on floor, and bed rails down)

180C5F9BDF6D46ACAAC4137E46DF988B.description: Use equipment, materials, and chemicals according to manufacturer guidelines

CFD4AD95F8E843BD9F4B0D51C54C372B.description: Maintain a safe work environment (e.g., proper storage of equipment, materials, and chemicals; proper containment of food and personal items; hair tied back and minimal jewelry)

0D2B4BEA75464A41BA1A41416F680018.description: Maintain a clean work area (e.g., cleaning agents, Clorox, and other disinfectants )

0B334E11D7B440AF8A49E8E1B84DB1C3.description: Describe evacuation plans used by various facilities and statewide alert codes

A9C9CFE6C144457A95C8C773D59E2A32.description: Use fire and chemical safety protocols (e.g., SDSs and the use of fire extinguishers)

8DCF11D629A8468FA844C45A11E6A17C.description: Handle and dispose of contaminated and hazardous items according to OSHA guidelines

D614463E1D90491AA403F2E113623880.description: Describe procedures for cleaning laboratory spills

9B1E4ED3B9594E7E8A92FDBD47C2BAF0.description: Comply with hazardous labeling requirements according to OSHA (e.g., safety signs, symbols, and special instructions)

ADD7F7BCD5344CBE9E8E3343F3360AA2.description: Demonstrate knowledge of isolation and the use of isolation procedures

67824D9408CE471885F17C94E013B0B6.description: Don, remove, and discard PPE (personal protective equipment such as gloves, gowns, masks, lab coats, goggles, and face shields) according to standard procedure

066BE78E8BEB4EB086B95E41CBDE657E.description: Use proper hand hygiene according CDC (Center for Disease Control)

F263E88FC8CE4C7EACE6B07F8736F5D6.description: Use Universal Precautions according to OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Administration) and use Transmission-based Precautions according to CDC (Center for Disease Control)

DABCDD33C8844EB2AD398367B13CB55B.description: Demonstrate knowledge of communicable diseases and blood borne pathogens

5AD893034FF84DB1968617C98EBDBFFE.description: APPLY STANDARD PRECAUTIONS AND SAFETY MEASURES
